title: South Africa’s Naspers launches bidding war for Just Eat
text:
The London-based food-delivery company rejected an $8.26-billion all-cash takeover offer from Prosus, the global deal-making arm of South Africa’s biggest tech conglomerate, Naspers. The offer challenges a $15-billion all-stock bid from Takeaway.com, with which Just Eat finalized merger plans in August. Some Just Eat shareholders are pushing Prosus to pitch a higher offer to outbid Takeaway.com. (Financial Times)

Talking point: Prosus—which made three previous attempts to acquire Just Eat—will have to convince the company’s board that the cash it’s offering now is more valuable than the prospect of joining forces with Takeaway. The interest in Just Eat underscores the opportunity giant tech firms see in the online food-delivery space. Prosus, an early Tencent investor, has stakes in Berlin-based Delivery Hero, India’s Swiggy and iFood in Brazil. Whether Just Eat decides to partner with Prosus or Takeaway, the move could help it rival competitors like SoftBank-backed Uber Eats and DoorDash and Amazon-backed Deliveroo.
